rComments: This class was not enjoyable at all. If you did the readings theres no point in going to class because he's  going to say exactly what you read( which makes you not want to read!!!!) I had a hard time not dying of boredom in this class. If you look around everyone is on their phone or laptop. Do not recommend if you actually want to learn something

cuthbert makes some tough material manageable.  the final project takes a lot of work, but  he is really helpful in getting through it.  he came in on a weekend, and spent a couple of hours just to answer questions.  I wish adv lighting was offered more often.  a lot of people don't know about him, but he is one of the best things about the depart.
Prof Cuthbert is great all-around. He supports student production work in this department and is very friendly.
Covers a lot, but good class.  One of my favorite teachers.  Easy readings, but keep up on them.

Professor Cuthbert is a bit strange, and he seems to have a bit of an ego issue- always trying to justify to us how great he is in our field but you get the idea it's really to himself.  If you don't know basic lighting already, don't take this, he operates as if somethings were self explanatory that are not.  Interesting and educational though.

Knows the material and makes it interesting and fun.  Kind of a weird sense of humor, but made me laugh.  One of the few theatre fac who actually works in the field, and brings that to the class.  Made everyone want to design lighting.
